intro: Camissonia megalantha, commonly known as the giant camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its large, showy white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. It has a low-growing, sprawling habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Camissonia megalantha is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many species of bellflowers.
